text: Oh man, this reminds me of when I got to go to the Louvre a few years ago. It was nice, though I had no intention of exploring everything. Of course, I got to see the Mona Lisa, but I was also really pleased with The Wedding at Cana, that ginormous painting directly across from the Mona Lisa.

text: The result of a surprising parternship between Nintendo and the Louvre museum in Paris, the biggest and most visited in the world. I had the chance to visit the Louvre a few times and I barely managed to see half of it. Of course, I did see the Mona Lisa which is the most popular attraction there. I'm curious to visit it again now that this 3DS guide exists and is handed out there.
author: SupraDarky

text: I was there last year and got to use the guide, and I thought it was very good. The Mona Lisa and other art in that wing were good but I preferred the Egyptian exhibit.
author: MetagrossZ

text: I've used it too.  If I recall correctly, I think it had a feature where you could use the 3DS camera to identify artwork and receive descriptions.
author: Ben Fischer

text: The biggest museum is Hermitage, actually...
author: pause_break

text: If you want to see the Mona Lisa, come to Madrid. In the Museo del Prado there is a replica crafted by someone in Leonardo's atelier. Maybe Leonardo himself. In fact, maybe this is the original one (at least it's more colourful). And it's not crowded at all.
author: Pablo GonzÃ¡lez Doval

text: I'm not sure why the mona lisa is so famous.  If I recall correctly, I remember hearing that di vinci himself didn't particularly like it, or that it wasn't his favorite.  It's fascinating to see what goes in and out of style.
author: zeldajerk
